security_audit.summary: Pure documentation and template skill containing only markdown files with code review guidelines. No executable code, network operations, or file system access beyond reading its own files. All 38 static findings are false positives triggered by git command documentation and markdown placeholders.

content.user_title: Request code review for quality verification
content.value_statement: Code issues caught early prevent costly fixes later. This skill dispatches a code-reviewer subagent to verify implementation against requirements before proceeding with development.
actual_capabilities: Dispatches code-reviewer subagent to analyze code changes between git commits
Compares implementation against provided plan or requirements document
Checks code quality, architecture decisions, and testing coverage
Categorizes issues by severity: Critical, Important, and Minor
Assesses production readiness with clear ready/not-ready verdict
Provides specific file and line number references for all issues
limitations: Requires git SHAs (BASE_SHA and HEAD_SHA) to identify what changed
Requires plan or requirements document to compare implementation against
Subagent needs read access to the codebase being reviewed
Does not automatically fix identified issues

use_cases.title: Task completion verification
use_cases.description: Review each completed task before moving to the next one to prevent issues from compounding

use_cases.title: Pre-merge quality gate
use_cases.description: Verify feature implementation meets requirements before merging code into main branch

use_cases.title: Fresh perspective debugging
use_cases.description: Get objective code review when stuck to identify issues and suggest solutions

prompt_templates.title: After task completion
prompt_templates.scenario: Task completed, need review before next
prompt_templates.prompt: Request code review for my implementation. WHAT: Added verification and repair functions. PLAN: Task 2 from docs/plans/deployment-plan.md. BASE_SHA: a7981ec HEAD_SHA: 3df7661. DESCRIPTION: Added verifyIndex() and repairIndex() with 4 issue types.

prompt_templates.title: Before merge to main
prompt_templates.prompt: Full code review before merge. WHAT: User authentication module. REQUIREMENTS: See RFC-001-auth.md. DIFF: Compare origin/main to current HEAD. Provide critical, important, and minor issues with file references.

prompt_templates.title: Complex bug fix review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my bug fix for memory leak in connection pool. WHAT: Added cleanup in finally blocks. DIFF: Compare HEAD~1 to HEAD. Focus on resource management and edge cases.

prompt_templates.title: Refactoring baseline
prompt_templates.prompt: Review current state before refactoring. WHAT: Database layer abstraction. PLAN: docs/plans/refactor-db.md. Get baseline assessment of current architecture and test coverage.

output_examples.input: Request code review for my user authentication module before merging to main
output: Strengths: Clean separation of concerns with auth middleware (auth.ts:15-42). Comprehensive test coverage for 8 authentication flows. Good error handling with specific error types.
Important: Missing rate limiting on login endpoint (security concern). No password reset flow documented in requirements.
Minor: Consider extracting JWT signing to separate utility. Inconsistent error message format across modules.
Assessment: Ready to merge with fixes. Core implementation is solid. Important issues should be addressed before production use.

output_examples.input: Just completed Task 3 - added search indexing with progress reporting. Review before Task 4
output: Strengths: Progress indicators working well (indexer.ts:45-52). Clean async handling. Edge cases covered for empty results.
Important: Missing cancellation support for long-running index operations. No cleanup on process interrupt.
Minor: Progress counter hardcoded to 100 items. Consider making configurable.
Assessment: Ready to proceed. Fix cancellation before Task 4, minor item noted for later.

best_practices: Review after each task in subagent-driven development to catch issues early before they compound
Always provide the plan or requirements document for comparison so review is meaningful
Act on feedback proportionally: Critical issues immediately, Important before proceeding, Minor noted for later
anti_patterns: Skipping review because code looks simple - simple code can still have bugs and security issues
Proceeding with unfixed Important issues that could cascade into bigger problems downstream
Ignoring valid technical feedback without providing counter-evidence or counter-examples

faq.question: What tools does this skill support?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. The code-reviewer subagent uses git commands to analyze changes.

faq.question: What git information do I need?
faq.answer: You need BASE_SHA (starting commit) and HEAD_SHA (ending commit). Get them with git rev-parse or git log --oneline.

faq.question: How long does review take?
faq.answer: Reviews complete in seconds to minutes depending on diff size. Larger changes take longer to review thoroughly.

faq.question: Is my code data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill only analyzes code locally using git diff. No code is sent to external services.

faq.question: What if I disagree with the review?
faq.answer: Push back with technical reasoning and evidence. The skill encourages disputing feedback you believe is incorrect.

faq.question: How is this different from IDE code review?
faq.answer: This skill provides holistic review against requirements and architecture. IDE tools focus on syntax and style. Use both.
